question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This class really showed me how life on land and in water is so interconnected and how many physiological characteristics came to be as an evolutionary response. I also learned how to better read scientific papers and understand them. Further, I learned how many ways to apply problem solving in real world applications.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to write a lab report, take good notes, read academic journals.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned various aspects of animal physiology, focusing on marine animals as well as humans. Examples of these subjects are animal metabolism, the nervous system, and diving physiology (among others). We also worked on a lab experiment and report, so we also worked on lab and writing skills.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: In this course I developed my note-taking skills, strengthened my critical thinking skills, writing skills, and gained hands-on learning in the lab. Through various writing exercises including three abstracts and a lab report, I gained valuable feedback to better my ability to write scientifically. In the lab, I got a refresher on how to pipette, vortex, and centrifuge samples.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the similarities and differences between human physiology and marine animal physiology, as well as how to write a scientific lab report

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the importance of countercurrent exchange in blood vessels, specifically that having blood flow in the opposite direction as water will help conserve heat in the body. This adaptation is present across many marine organisms as well as all endotherms. I also learned about how different systems in the body such as the nervous and endocrine systems interact in order to send and receive signals and have sensory capabilities. In addition, I learned a lot about scientific writing, specifically how to write the abstract section of a lab report, and I got practice with writing the rest of a lab report.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to properly write a lab report, especially how an abstract should be structured. I learned of the proper procedures in a lab environment and what is expected of me as a member of a lab group. I also enjoyed learning how the bodies of several animals function and where it evolved from, which is what was taught during the lecture.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked the abstract paper assignments. They were very helpful and helped me learn how to read and dissect scientific papers. The draft deadline was also good to make sure I did not leave writing the whole lab report to the last minute.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the abstract and student presentation assignments were very helpful.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The professor was very easy to talk to and in addition to teaching us complicated material, would joke around with us to make it a fun and relaxed learning environment. The professor also sent out review guides before each test, which were helpful to remind us exactly what topics we had studied.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked the structure of this course. The atmosphere was very inviting and open to questions and comments. Josh kept the atmosphere light and engaging. I do feel, however, that the course was extremely fast paced. It was difficult to fully understand concepts enough to answer questions on the exam and get full credit.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: the classes were engaging, and I enjoyed the balance between lectures and more hands on activities such as lab and dissections

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Having some of our afternoons free was very helpful for me; after being in lecture for 2 1/2 hours it is nice to have the afternoon to work on lab or class-related material. Also, at the beginning it was helpful to split the day into classes in the morning and lab in the afternoon; that gave us some more freedom in our schedule. In addition, the professor put a lot of helpful resources in Canvas such as scientific writing resources and all of the lecture slides in Canvas so that we could access them easily.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Josh facilitated my learning through the multiple labs that he held during our class time; these labs were very engaging and helped me to grasp the information substantially better because I was able to see the structures we discussed during the lecture. If I were Josh, I would certainly keep having these labs and experimental activities as it is very helpful in understanding the material and it helped bring the classmates together and work with one another.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The professor and TA challenged us to improve our scientific writing skills through the Abstract assignments and the lab report itself. In addition, the paper presentations were a helpful exercise in in scientific communication. The lectures themselves were intellectually stimulating because they were fast-paced but comprehensible, and they analyzed components of animal physiology from multiple different perspectives. I like that the professor would give us comparisons between human physiology and that of various marine organisms so that we could better understand the importance of different systems.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Josh was very enthusiastic about what he was teaching us which is what made the class so enjoyable. He made a relatively difficult subject easy to learn and I very much enjoyed the way he structured the class.

response_text: I would suggest this course to another student as it contains valuable information for anyone who may have a career relating to organisms and physiology. But be prepared for the fast pace.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: take it, it's a great class! you learn a lot about human health and marine life simultaneously

response_text: Don't procrastinate, especially with the lab report. It is a lot to work on at once. Also, accept and learn from professor and TA feedback on Abstract and lab report assignments, because they can be very helpful in improving scientific writing skills. Take good notes for the exams, because they are difficult but they are open-note.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I would tell a student that this course may seem difficult at first, but over time, it will start to make more sense and Josh is a very good professor.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I developed the skill to think deeply and analytically.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

I learned how to tell the properties of chemicals based on their structure

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course encouraged me to learn to think like a scientist throughout the semester. I learned to do be persistent and curious in doing research and got comfortable operating pipettes, freeze-dryers, and other lab equipment. Lastly, I gained new perspective about the role of chemistry in our lives, even when we aren't aware of these chemicals.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: One thing I learned is that the plastics that we use everyday are probably harmful even though nobody is really saying or doing about them, like silicones and plastic that smells. I also learned about chemistry from a biological perspective. The instructor facilitated my learning by being extremely knowledgeable about local biological and ecological systems. He was always open to answering any question during lectures, and lectures were set up in a way in which we would have time to answer and discuss questions. He seemed to always have an answer and an insight about the way something worked. He also would come up with questions too about things that nobody knows the answer to yet, which I thought was very insightful. Lectures with strong visuals were the most stimulating. Low stakes quizzes challenged me to think about the course content. I appreciated the humor in the class, it kept me engaged as well. Often we would discuss the content of the lectures during lunch. It was cool that our lab was focused on designing an experiment that could eventually be published. Time that I spent outside of class was on the lab project, while we were running experiments I would spend at least two our three hours working. The TA helped us when were stuck on lab problems. This is a cool class and it challenges the way you think about the world. I definitely recommend. The field trips were cool at the beginning, I never would have been able to see the inside of a blue crab facility. We also caught blue crabs to cook at a lake in NC.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course is by far the most interesting class you will take. The main take away I took from the class is all the detail aspects of animals that affect the way they behave. Dr. Dan liked to extrapolate this out to explain humans.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to develop research methods and questions.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor was engaging and easy to talk to.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Dan gave lectures in a narrative style, rich in stories. This made him extremely engaging. Unlike other professors that focus on sharing facts, Dan presented us with information in a more palatable way. Additionally, the lab was extremely engaging. Our project was trying to restore seagrass beds by gluing seeds to clams. In the beginning, I felt the project would be impossible. Dan took an off-hands approach, but he believed in us and our abilities. When we'd get stuck, Dan would lend a hand, but for the most part relied on us to conduct the research project. In the end, I was proud of the work we accomplished and felt this was the most valuable lab I've gotten from a class. My only criticism for this class is that some of the lectures were a bit heavy. I really liked when Dr. Dan made his own diagrams on his slides, such as his spider drawings. I think adding more visual aids like that could help improve the comprehensibility of the heavier lectures.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor, Dr. Dan, encouraged us to learn out of an appreciation for science rather than a need to memorize concepts and achieve high grades -- the way of learning we practiced in this class is very valuable to me and is important to being a good scientists. I would keep this narrative method of instruction and I would also keep the group projects because they encouraged group bonding and helped us become better researchers and collaborators. I would also keep the field trips because these were some of my most memorable moments at the marine lab.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The structure of the course facilitate a learning environment because there was a strong interaction and relationship between student and teacher. The field trips in the beginning of the year were well designed and entertaining.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to identify all species of sea turtles. I understood the importance of endangered species and conservation efforts in place to protect those species. I learned how to protect and understand the life cycle of sea turtles.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: During this course, I learned about the current threats sea turtles are facing (fishing bycatch, plastic pollution, boat strikes, cold stunning, ect). I learned about the anatomy of sea turtles and we did a necropsy on one. I also learned about sea turtle nesting behavior and arribada nesting.

2.
